channel.title: Taking out "SERVER"(so it goes to my server no matter wat) and adding "password"
channel.description: i need help. i want to take out the "SERVER:" and make it automatically go to my server i want to add a "Password" part

item.title: Taking out "SERVER"(so it goes to my server no matter wat) and adding "password"
item.dc:creator: @vartankid vartankid
item.description:
@vartankid wrote:

oh sdouble uhh so how would i put it?
return new URL(“68.5.247.192” + “:” + (80 + anInt958));
[br][size=1]Posted at: August 17, 2006, 07:05:39 PM[/size][hr]nvm fixed myself. (compile says so)

item.title: Taking out "SERVER"(so it goes to my server no matter wat) and adding "password"
item.dc:creator: @vartankid vartankid
item.description:
@vartankid wrote:

client.java:7112: ‘)’ expected
return new URL(“68.5.247.192”:" + (80 + anInt958));
^
client.java:7112: unclosed string literal
return new URL(“68.5.247.192”:" + (80 + anInt958));
^
client.java:7113: ‘;’ expected
}
^
3 errors

item.title: Taking out "SERVER"(so it goes to my server no matter wat) and adding "password"
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Find

return new URL

in client.java.

Replace the line you found with:

("yourserverip":" + (80 + anInt958)

To get rid of the “Server” box, just search down for

"Server: "

And comment out that line. Tada!

You can add a password box by looking a the server box generating code and writing your own box. Make sure you correctly modify the methods where the box sets up the length of text allowed…etc, and that it’s sending the password to the server in the right place.

Read full topic
